title: VAR decision was 'deflating' admits Frank Lampard after Chelsea's 2-1 defeat to Liverpool – video
text:
Liverpool maintained their perfect start to the Premier League season after a 2-1 victory away to Frank Lampard's Chelsea. César Azpilicueta converted from close range but a goal that would have made it 1-1 was ruled out when replays showed that Mason Mount had strayed offside during the buildup.

Instead, Jürgen Klopp’s side found themselves two goals up at half-time and despite a resilient Chelsea performance they couldn't score a second to level the scores. Liverpool have now restored their five-point lead over title rivals Manchester City
description: Chelsea's César Azpilicueta was denied a goal after it was adjudged that Mason Mount was offside in the buildup
